TopicTitle: Constant crashes on Mac OS X

Articles.Content:
I'm getting about 4 crashes per hour, even when doing nothing.

For example, I just loaded the game, loaded my save, and went to VAB...hang then crash.

I have un-modded game, newest version, no other programs running, new Macbook Pro, SSD, 8GB RAM, 1GB graphics card.

This is terrible!

Have you tried verifying the game cache? (In Steam [assuming you got it there] right-click on the game and go Properties>Local Files>Verify integrity of game cache)
If not, something could've gone wrong during the download - it might be worth deleting everything and re-downloading the game (Steam>right click on game>delete local content)
Don't forget to back up your saves folder first!

Thanks for the suggestions Isidor10.

I've tried this, and indeed a few corrupt files were found, but then I had crashes again.

I also deleted and re-downloaded+installed, again, having crashes all the time.

Any other ideas?

I've been playing KSP on my iMac for a while now, suffering through the crashes. Last night, I found a post on reddit that describes how to update the Unity engine to 64bit inside the KSP package. I did this. It's amazing.

Since, I've installed some serious visual mods and run at over 5GB, no crashes, period.

Another thing: if you have a retina mac, switch to a non-retina resolution before opening. Specifically, a non-HDPI resolution. 

https://www.reddit.com/r/KerbalSpaceProgram/comments/3laqnf/psa_ksp_64_bit_works_on_mac_os_x/
Note, make sure you download the 4.6.4 version of Unity, not the latest one.

Thank you for this everlast, this worked perfectly!

Much better performance and only very infrequent crashes!
